chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse programs.

superMiscConds.notes:
COMPAS Evaluation and follow through.
Submit DNA sample when Defendant reports to jail.
No contact with victim Casandra C (D.O.B. 2-14-2000) and Evelyn C.  
Register as sex offender under the guidelines of WI SORP.
Sex offender counseling.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment is summarily affirmed. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Ralph J. Sczygelski is relieved of his
obligation to further represent Ronald Johnson in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
